name: Hampton Inn & Suites - Miami Airport / Blue Lagoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After all of the great reviews of this hotel, I was expecting more. It's an ok hotel. The bed was nice and the room was average. I didn't think it deserved the glowing reviews. No room service is available. Please note that it is under construction at this time. Had I known that, I would have taken my $169 somewhere else.
reviews.title: Not that great

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel pre and post cruise. Hotel in good condition and very clean. Stayed in the one bedroom suite. The Hampton bed was very comfortable. Hampton breakfast also good. On return from cruise, the hotel let us check into our room at 10:15 am - very impressed with that.
reviews.title: great choice

reviews.text: Overall excellent value and will use the hotel on future stays in the Miami Airport area.
reviews.title: Great for a stopover but it's not a resort hotel!

reviews.text: We didn't get a great deal on the room - US$280, but it was March Break and not a lot of choice in Miami. From our Miami hotel experiences, you need to spend in Miami to get anything decent.
reviews.title: Above and Beyond Service

likes.liked: — Location to the Cruise Ship termminal and Price

reviews.text: Stayed here before and after our cruise. Rooms were clean and spacious. Before our cruise, we stayed on floor 8 which was good. After our cruise, our room was on the 2nd floor above the registration desk. The room was bigger but being so close to the lobby was a little noisier than I expected. We really liked the convenience of being next door to the 24 hour Walgreens allowing us to stock up on those items that are so difficult now to bring on the airplane. One other note, I found that booking through the Hampton Inn website got me the best deal and it also allowed me to register for a triple A rate and add my airline miles number for partner points.
reviews.title: Great for Pre & Post Cruise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for one night prior to our cruise. The hotel offers free transportation to their facility from the Miami Airport. We had to wait about 30 minutes, but the driver arrived and was friendly and helpful. We arrived at the hotel and found it to be very clean and nice. Our room was clean and had plenty of space.

reviews.text: The hotel suggested an Italian restaurant that was across the street and within walking distance. It was OK but nothing I would look up again. There are also two drug stores at the corner of the nearest intersection which was nice to have.
reviews.title: Great Pre-Post Cruise Hotel!!!

likes.disliked: — I can't think of one thing I did not like!

reviews.text: I would completely agree with the others that have said the beds were very comfortable. The breakfast the next morning was very good with a nice seating area.
reviews.title: Comfortable and convenient

likes.disliked: — Prices seem to go up at times

reviews.title: Loved the bed!
reviews.text: We were able to sign up for transportation to the cruise port which was on time and reasonably priced.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel for the price! Recieved a real good price with my husbands bcaaa membership. Got to the hotel at 9:00 am after flying all night . They said our room wasn't ready yet but to go up and have the comp breakfast that they serve everyday which is huge and isn't your usual hotel freebee breakfast. there was hot as well as cold things to eat. Room was awesome. King size fluffy comforter lots of pillows didn't want to leave bed. Pool and surrounding area is also clean and well kept. Area hotel is in isn't that bad theres a Wallgreans, Publex grocery store , Burger king, ect... Staff is awesome most helpful. We stayed there one night pre-cruise there's a shuttle that picks you up at the airport for free when you arrive and they can arrange a shuttle to pick you up to take you to the cruise port for $10.00 per person. way more than a taxi. hotel is near the airport but never heard one plane unless outside by the pool. Will recommend this hotel to anyone that asks.
reviews.title: Great hotel stay for the price

reviews.text: For $200/night I cannot believe what you get. You get a standard Hampton room (and an old one at that). Nothing special and not in a great area at all. As Diamond I had to ask for upgrade. Service was okay, but for the price you have got to be kidding. Average to old room and bad neighborhood.
reviews.title: #1 hotel--no way, averge at best

likes.liked: — There is a resturant across the street--hole in the wall Casa Juan. Just be careful at night.

reviews.text: My husband and I stay at Hampton Inns every week on business because we know that we will have a comfortable room and a good hot breakfast for me and a breakfast bag for him on his way to the office. I had quite a bit to carry up on our breakfast tray on Sunday and I was helped by one of the employees by carrying the extra tray up to our room. This definitely was one of the best Hampton's that we have stayed at in the whole state! The pool area is beautiful and very spacious and there was a great winding staircase going up to the second floor. They have secure elevators that allow only guests to go up to the rooms. Check-in was quick and efficient; we arrived before check-in time and our room wasn't ready yet, but they had our requested room near the elevator ready in no time because we are members of Hilton Honors Program. It is definitely worth joining even if you are an in-frequent traveler with points to earn free stays and special treatment.
reviews.title: The H in Hampton Stands for Helpful
Would definitely stay here again!
reviews.text: We got a suite with a mini-kitchen and it was wonderful. It was very clean and was well stocked with dishes, pots & pans, tupperware, and silverware.
The staff is very helpful - the desk staff and the cleaning staff. The cleaning staff was excellent.
reviews.title: Hampton Blue Lagoon so much better than their Dadeland property

likes.liked: — Modern and Clean. Friendly Staff. Excellent Service. Value for Money.

reviews.text: My family and I got stuck up a creek because the "Days Inn Miami Airport" screwed up our reservations and gave our room away; they're idiots over there trust me.
reviews.title: Awesome!!!!

reviews.text: The Hampton in however was probably one of the nicest hotel rooms I think I have ever stayed in. The hotel itself was spectacular and extremely clean. My favorite part was the breakfast it was so much better than any of the hotels I have stayed at recently. The staff was extremely friendly and well spoken; it has been my experience that most places in Miami people don't even speak English but they sure did here! We were traveling with my 2 year old son and we asked for a crib at check in and by the time we got to our room the crib was already there and setup; my son slept very well so I assume it was just as comfy as our nice big fluffy bed.
reviews.title: Unbelievable awesome group coordinator & staff

reviews.text: The location is great too, you have a CVS, Walgreen’s, Publix, Burger King and a nice Chinese restaurant all within a 2 minute walk; it's literally right across the street, just be careful and use the crosswalks. The airport shuttle was very quick and efficient and during our stay we never heard any sounds from the airport, the room was perfectly silent. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!
reviews.title: great hotel for precruise

likes.disliked: — great for pre and post cruise, good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a group of 25 and decided on this hotel based on the reviews from TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed. The group coordinator of this hotel continually went above and beyond to ensure our stay was more than Satisfactory. The hotel does offer free shuttle from the airport. Due to our group size Lourdes arranged for airport pickup for everyone (nominal fee pp). The drivers were waiting with newer/clean vans & trailer for luggage. We were taken to the hotel and after checkin our prearranged transportation took us over to Bayside & some of the group to South Beach. When we wanted to stay longer we called the driver and he said NO PROBLEM. They picked us up where and when they said they would. The next morning the drivers were again waiting to shuttle us to the port. All transportation was arranged through the hotel group coordinator (fees were reasonable). She suggested destinations, amount of time needed, etc. On our return to the port we did not have transportation booked we were considering ship based excursions. I emailed Hampton Inn from the ship and the Group Coordinator arranged for pickup--keep in mind that we were not staying at the hotel on our return--We were going home. She could not reach me by phone to confirm we worked via email. I called the driver when we reached Miami at 6am and he said Lourdes was unsure of the time but he'd be waiting with a group sign at the pier around 7am. Our group was split up getting off the ship and it delayed them over 40 minutes but they waited to take us all to the airport as a group. When we arrived at the airport the Group Coordinator of Hampton Inn (Lourdes) had called me--she wanted to see if our trip was satisfactory and if the driver picked us up as promised. Keep in mind this was a Sunday Morning and she works Monday-Friday. When we checked in the hotel on Saturday (her off day)--she also called me at the hotel checking to see if everything was satisfactory upon check in. We've stayed in Miami before and did not care for the hotel, staff or location. At the Wyndham during our last stay we were told by the bus driver not to go out at night the area is too dangerous--needless to say we didn't enjoy Miami or feel safe. We didn't feel uncomfortable at this hotel at all--great security--you must have an active hotel key in order to take the elevator in this hotel. Clean, reliable arranged transportation allowed us to enjoy the sights of Miami. Again, rooms are clean and comfortable---it's not the Ritz--it's an affordable and clean hotel with excellent service.
reviews.title: Nice Place - Great to use when taking a cruise from Port of Miami

likes.liked: — Property is well maintained, pool area was nice and not overrun with people
likes.disliked: — our room/floor was non-smoking but we smelled smoke--floor above or below probably so that was annoying

reviews.text: Great hotel, We arrived on an early flight and tho our rooms were not ready, we were able to sit by the pool. We had missed the breakfast, but an employee was kind enough to get my daughter and me "breakfasts to go" Hotel staff was very helpful in getting us into our rooms by noon. Very clean, wonderful beds, pillows, and comfortors! Great location-across the street is a Walgreens, wendys, bakery, and a little market. Would definately stay here again! Price w/AAA was great, too. Also there was a shuttle to the port for $10/person

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of the best hotel stays I've ever had. Stayed here prior to a cruise after having travelled for almost 24 hours straight. The staff were friendly and helpful and allowed us to check in early. Free parking was nice. Yes, it is gated, but that made me feel like the car would be safe. Neighborhood wasn't bad at all.
reviews.title: Most comfortable beds EVER!

likes.disliked: — There was nothing I didn't like.

reviews.text: Rooms were obviously pretty new, clean and really nice. Good size too. The best thing was the amazingly comfortable beds. I don't sleep as well at home as I did there! For being SO close to the airport it was really quiet. Not much of a view of the lagoon, but that wasn't a big deal to me--it's an airport hotel.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic Stay AND Service
Best Near Airport, But Beware
reviews.text: There aren't TOO many places to eat nearby--a Burger King and grocery store across the street and a few small Cuban cafes, but that's about it. Gas station with a store and pharmacy across the street were convenient as well. The hotel's complimentary breakfast is great! Hot food (sausage biscuits and gravy and eggs when I was there) as well as fruit, cereal, yogurt, pastries, many different breads/bagels/muffins, hot and cold drinks was served in a nice area with plenty of seating. I was there 30 minutes before the end of breakfast and there was still more than enough food left.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have a business center with free internet for checking e-mail and flight info. They have a small "store" on sight with snacks and necessities as well. Pool and hot tub area were a bit small, but looked nice and well kept--didn't get a chance to use it because it was raining. Would definitely stay here again if I have the opportunity.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: I only write reviews when my hotels stays are either amazing or awful. And this stay falls under amazing.
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Blue Lagoon

likes.liked: — The no problem attitude from the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great one night pre cruise hotel. We arrived into Miami late and booked this hotel because the free shuttle runs until 1AM. We waited about 20 minutes, our only complaint was the hotel name was hard to read on the van so just be on the lookout or you might miss it. Our room had a view of the Burger King corp HQ and the runway. Lots of fast food places as well as a Publix across the street. Hotel helped us arrange a $10 pp transfer to the pier. Free breakfast was the typical Hampton breakfast. Overall a great value.
reviews.title: Great Pre Cruise Hotel
I will book Hampton Inn again
reviews.text: For an overnight stay near an airport, the hotel was great. I felt quite secure, the accommodations were nice, and the complimentary breakfast was convenient. I was also able to slip across the street to the shopping center to pick up a few things in the morning. The one area that needs improvement is the airport van shuttle. After a full day flight, it was a long, tiresome wait for the shuttle to finally arrive. One had to keep on guard, watching every vehicle that came and went to check for the right van.

I stayed at the Hampton Inn Airport/Blue Lagoon for one precruise night Nov. 3. I can't say enough good things about it. The free shuttle got me from the airport to the hotel quickly. The people at the front desk were helpful, polite, and professional. My room was very clean and comfortable. I have stayed at some fine hotels in my lifetime. Many of those should send their employees to this hotel to learn how it's done. I walked across the street to a shopping center to get dinner (several restaurants, Publix, 2 drugstores) and walked a block to St. Dominic's for Mass Sunday morning. Also took another walk that morning. I am a 64-year-old woman traveling alone and felt very safe. The free breakfast wasn't anything to write home about but was adequate. The price was reasonable for Miami.
reviews.title: Great hotel

aka: Hampton Inn & Suites - Miami Airport / Blue Lagoon Hotel Miami
description: The Hampton Inn & Suites Miami Airport hotel is located at the Waterford Corporate Park - Blue Lagoon complex, the perfect location for those visiting Miami for business or pleasure: Located just 5 minutes from Miami International Airport, 15 minutes from Downtown Miami, Brickell, Coral Gables, Coconut Grove and Doral. The Port of Miami is just a few miles from our door. Close to the Dolphin Mall, International Mall, Dadeland Mall & Aventura Mall and the South Florida Beaches.
